meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>separate</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji> is someone who is different from who they were before. I saw you a year ago and you were someone else. Now you're a <vocabulary>different person</vocabulary>, in a good way! You're a <vocabulary>changed man</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
